title: Flower 1
desc: This is one of three that I originally made, I lost track of one of them. Materials used include card, acrylic paint, dirt and P.V.A. glue.

title: Shell
desc: I built this study of a seashell from corrugated card and acrylic paint. The spiral ridges are the exposed corrugations of varying thicknesses of box cardboard, with the outer skin peeled off.

title: Aztec Blue Eagle
desc:
A bird was needed for a local event, I was told it might be nice if it was a bit Aztec. Next thing I knew this fella was flapping around my flat.

This isn't a great photo, it's a bit blurry. The eagle has flown and disappeared so it's the best I have.

title: Albi the Alpaca
desc: This alpaca (plus unnatural horns) was created for utility - to cover up an ugly central heating controller on a friend's wall.
materials: Corrugated card, squash balls, cable ties, acrylic paint

title: Tlaloc
desc: This is my USB memory stick, I built it up with Miliput and carved this character into it, based on Tlaloc, the Aztec god of rain and fertility.

title: Crystalline City
desc: I had a college modelmaking brief to make an architectural model based on a natural structure - I chose a lead crystal (as viewed under an electron microscope).

title: Retro Lounge
desc: This tiny model was a project for my modelmaking college course.

title: Man and Woman
desc:
A tree formed from two intertwined figures, male and female. Don't feel bad if you can't see it, you aren't alone.

My favourite parts are the tiny transparent cubes. I found the spherical stone which stops the bottle in a field, I think it might be a musket ball.
